intro: Tipularia harae, commonly known as the Harae's tipularia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tipularia harae is considered a species of conservation concern.
